chunks.zh: 怎样克服入睡时对声音很敏感这件事
chunks.en: How to overcome being very sensitive to sound when falling asleep

chunks.zh: OP 睡觉时，但凡有点动静，比如握手楼对面有人讲话、风吹窗户的异响，都会打消我好不容易堆起来的睡觉。
chunks.en: When OP is trying to sleep, any slight noise, such as someone talking in the building opposite mine or the strange sound of the wind blowing against the window, will ruin the sleepiness I've worked so hard to build up.

chunks.zh: 有时零点半躺床上睡觉能熬到三点都睡不着。
chunks.en: Sometimes I lie in bed at 12:30 AM and can't fall asleep until 3 AM.

chunks.zh: 最近连续一个月使用耳塞也导致耳道发炎了，感觉不能太依赖这玩意了😭😭😭😭
chunks.en: Recently, using earplugs for a month straight has caused inflammation in my ear canal, and I feel like I can't rely on them too much 😭😭😭😭

chunks.zh: 精神内守，识神不可外放。
chunks.en: Keep your spirit inward, and don't let your conscious mind wander outward.

chunks.zh: 以呼吸为法，拴住心猿意马
chunks.en: Use breathing as a method to restrain your restless mind.

chunks.zh: 睡不着就睡不着，没啥大不了的，失眠造成第二天感觉上的效率低大都并非失眠本身造成（而是你觉得睡不好就应该很困）。
chunks.en: If you can't sleep, you can't sleep, it's not a big deal. The feeling of low efficiency the next day caused by insomnia is mostly not caused by the insomnia itself (but because you think you should be very sleepy if you don't sleep well).

chunks.zh: 别把睡觉看的太重，越看的重，越想睡越睡不着。
chunks.en: Don't take sleep too seriously. The more you value it, the more you want to sleep, the less you can sleep.

chunks.zh: 飞机✈️入睡法
chunks.en: Airplane ✈️ sleep method

chunks.zh: 个人经历的总结：精神太紧张了，看看睡眠和心理医生。
chunks.en: Summary of personal experience: You are too stressed, see a sleep and psychological doctor.

chunks.zh: 尝试听自己的呼吸声，这样会减少外部的声音入耳，就能很快的入眠
chunks.en: Try listening to your own breathing, which will reduce external sounds from entering your ears, and you will be able to fall asleep quickly.

chunks.zh: 做正念冥想 带耳塞/听音乐入睡
chunks.en: Do mindfulness meditation. Use earplugs/listen to music to fall asleep.

chunks.zh: @SimleCp 听不到的话说明不敏感
chunks.en: @SimleCp If you can't hear it, it means you are not sensitive.

chunks.zh: @SimleCp 我是能听到的，iPhone 的铃声还是挺大声的
chunks.en: @SimleCp I can hear it, the iPhone's ringtone is quite loud.

chunks.zh: @SimleCp 不容易听到，我是买了个手环带着睡觉，用手环震动闹钟
chunks.en: @SimleCp It's not easy to hear. I bought a bracelet to wear while sleeping and use the bracelet's vibration alarm.

chunks.zh: @SimleCp 我戴耳罩听不到手机闹钟的，戴耳罩睡的第一天直接睡过头了。
chunks.en: @SimleCp I can't hear my phone alarm when I wear earmuffs. The first day I slept with earmuffs, I overslept.

chunks.zh: 后来买了个小米手环定闹钟，晚上睡觉的时候戴顺便检测一下睡眠质量。
chunks.en: Later, I bought a Xiaomi bracelet to set an alarm, and I wear it when I sleep at night to check my sleep quality.

chunks.zh: 就是噪敏了。
chunks.en: It's just noise sensitivity.

chunks.zh: 我上大学时候，宿舍里打牌，舍友玩电脑我都能睡着。
chunks.en: When I was in college, I could fall asleep in the dormitory even if my roommates were playing cards or playing computer games.

chunks.zh: 但是结婚之后莫名其妙的开始噪敏了，只要在家就会不自觉的主动去注意邻居有什么动静，然后就很烦躁，陷入一种恶性循环。
chunks.en: But after getting married, I inexplicably started to become noise-sensitive. As long as I'm at home, I unconsciously and proactively pay attention to any movements made by my neighbors, and then I get very irritable and fall into a vicious cycle.

chunks.zh: 有时候心情好了，或者白天很累就好一些。
chunks.en: Sometimes I feel better when I'm in a good mood or very tired during the day.

chunks.zh: 你可以试试下面这些办法，慢慢改善吧https://zhuanlan.zhihu.com/p/675878873
chunks.en: You can try the following methods to improve it slowly: https://zhuanlan.zhihu.com/p/675878873

chunks.zh: @SimleCp 把手机声音开到最大，可以听到的
chunks.en: @SimleCp Turn the phone volume to the maximum, you can hear it.

chunks.zh: @SD10 我去看过，给我开了好多治疗神经的药，人都麻了。
chunks.en: @SD10 I went to see a doctor, and they prescribed a lot of nerve medication, which made me feel numb.

chunks.zh: 效果也一般
chunks.en: The effect was also so-so.

chunks.zh: @DissDoge #1 在这个方针指导下，有两种落地方案1 、 美国军人 2 分钟睡眠法：神识指挥全身进行放松，从头到脚。
chunks.en: @DissDoge #1 Under this guideline, there are two implementation plans: 1. The US military's 2-minute sleep method: Consciously command the whole body to relax, from head to toe.

chunks.zh: 做两遍，就能睡着（守住你的肉身）2 、呼吸法，一呼一吸之间增加了停顿。
chunks.en: Do it twice and you can fall asleep (guard your body). 2. Breathing method, increasing the pause between inhalation and exhalation.

chunks.zh: 通过控制呼吸节奏，降低交感神经，增加副交感神经控制，从而睡着
chunks.en: By controlling the breathing rhythm, reducing the sympathetic nerves, and increasing the parasympathetic nerve control, you can fall asleep.

chunks.zh: 一样，别人在我旁边翻书都能把我吵醒，不过我戴隔音耳机一整夜都没什么问题
chunks.en: Same here. Someone flipping through a book next to me can wake me up, but I have no problem wearing noise-canceling headphones all night.

chunks.zh: 听听阿尔法波音乐试试
chunks.en: Try listening to Alpha wave music.

chunks.zh: 开着电视硬睡试试，以毒攻毒
chunks.en: Try falling asleep with the TV on, fight fire with fire.

chunks.zh: 你这像是有点神经衰弱，所以异常敏感，建议是去看下医生
chunks.en: It seems like you have some neurasthenia, so you are extremely sensitive. It is recommended to see a doctor.

chunks.zh: 搞个小音箱，打开流媒体搜 sleep ，调整到合适的恰好听不见其他声音的音量。
chunks.en: Get a small speaker, open a streaming service, search for 'sleep,' and adjust the volume to a suitable level where you can barely hear other sounds.

chunks.zh: 只能换个地方租房住，我就是，现在很安静非常舒服
chunks.en: You can only move to another place to rent. I did, and now it's very quiet and comfortable.
